intro: Zahlbrucknera lutea, commonly known as the yellow Zahlbrucknera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native habitat.
